title: Frankly RiotWaargh, I don't want the dumb Noxus you're pushing for
body:
Referring to this comment, among others: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/EEvHQdg5-kled-and-riven?comment=000200000000

Why Waargh? Because contrary to what people think, originally Noxus wasn't purely on the '(physical) might makes right' maxim. It was, for better or worse, a social darwinistic meritocracy. It's why they allowed Morgana to _live_ in their city, to just open a fucking bakery so she could survive, while Demacia and Kayle turned her away.

It's why {{champion:50}} was respected despite being crippled. Did any of you new Riot writers, or the supporters on these boards, actually read his backstory at all? 

In Swain's backstory, he was crippled since he was a _teenager_.

> The doctor gawked in horror as the young adolescent answered questions about his health and age with a calm, even stare. Even behind the echoing crack as the sand counterweights reset his tibia, Swain’s measuring gaze never flickered, nor did his eyes twitch from the pop of his fibula.

> Normally a crippled boy would be turned away in shame from Noxus’ proud legion

He was respected by his men for his ability to lead.

> The men who've served under him (and survived) have remained in his charge with unshakable faith and loyalty. He leapt through the High Command's hierarchy, often ascending when superiors requested demotions to join his unit. 

He was legitimately going to become Grand General in due time without political maneuvering, but Darkwill used his position to sideline him out of fear of being usurped.

> His rise to power seemed unceasing until he was suddenly relegated to inactive status prior to the Ionian Invasion - a bewildering decision which reeked of bureaucratic subversion.

Even then, the most bewildering thing is both Rioters and who supports their mindset, thinking that somehow old age and magic powers means that person is 'scheming' or 'weak'. Holy heck, are you guys still watching Disney? Did we not move past the Brawn Good Brains Bad trope from the freaking 80s and 90s!? 

In Runeterra, EVERYONE has magic powers.

http://i1.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/008/509/everyone2.jpg

Good, bad, ugly, sexy, skinny, fat, human, Yordle.

You, Riot Waargh, make fun of Darius for understanding what's best for **the greater good of the nation and his people**, that Darius himself knew he was made of strong physical stuff but not smart enough to rule. Because surprise surprise, he is wiser than you, RiotWaaargh, in knowing it takes more than muscles to rule a nation. So he will support the one with the literal years of distinguished service and experience and the cunning and ruthless to rule a nation like Noxus.

And the real kicker. All this griping from champs about Swain not being 'strong' enough.

Fine. Have them challenge him in-lore.

That's the Noxus way, isn't it? It's the way you yourself Riot says is the Noxus way. They have to challenge him and win, to prove themselves right. Otherwise, they are hypocrites and cowards. In fact, the very kind of person they (and all the IRL new-Lores) think Swain is.

Oh on new-lores. If you so much as say 'derp derp old lore isn't canon no more derp derp', fuck you. Because the 'Evil Chancellor' stereotype you've constructed in your heads that is the sole trait of Swain is false. And makes you hypocrites, because for that stereotype to be true, means you're specifically picking and choosing bits of old-lore to support it while trying to ignore the bits that don't.

Frankly, I think you guys jumped on the lore binge only when it got easier to follow. None of you actually read the _Journal of Justice_ did you? You didn't see the fake reader letters, the hidden messages, the cues and timeline through the League Judgements. There was a writer or writers who worked for over 3 - 4 IRL years at Riot, to detail the entire plot behind Swain working with LeBlanc and Darius and every other subtle hint and actual DEPTH OF STORY to Noxus.

I don't blame you for not following it. Not everyone knew how much detail was actually locked in the Journal of Justice, and by the time people noticed, it as too late. It's not an ideal way to convey information or story.

But I'll be damned if you will be that flippant about the effort and writing of whoever was in the lore department for Riot.

If Riot's going to reduce its backstory for Noxus (and Demacia to an extent), which was a wonderful near-Song-of-Ice-and-Fire level of gray and intrigue and sacrifice, into a 1980s Saturday Morning Cartoon archaic story structure meant to be palatable and easier to understand then a modern Disney movie - then I wish you luck. 

You wasted a good plot. You wasted good characters. You wasted the Riot writers before you who tried to elevate a story beyond being just another MOBA plot.

I'm going to guess you're going to reduce Swain to the Evil Chancellor stereotype in his VUG/remake, which is the real pity. I was looking forward to it, but now I realize it'll only be a downgrade for his lore character. He'll likely not be Swain anymore post-VGU; he'll just be Disney's Jafar with a League skin on top.

replies.body:
Duuude, whoa.   I'm explaining how Kled sees the world, not how the world is.   

And while his point of view is a part of that nation, it is a response to some of the negatives in that society.  It's an emotional perspective coming from that society's marginalized rural people, which make a large portion of its army's enlisted ranks.  An army whose actions primarily benefit Noxus prime and the other cities.

I love Kled. In many ways his grit and bravado is heroic but he's totally irrational... And that's the point.
Well, a crazed redneck yordle tripping on mushroom juice might not be the best reference for Noxian standards anyways XD

Sadly he's the best we have gotten in a long time to view Noxus after the retcon. 

And Sion in a sense, but Sion revealed and confirmed a few political plots.

GP carves bones for no reason, Thresh is defeated by a GF ex Machina and we still have no idea what 'policies' Azir or Xerath are planning on when either actually wins.
Let's just say you don't have a great track record in dealing with villains.

as  far as writing for riot i dont think its right or clever to just out right tell people that people are evil wrong or negative everyones point of view should be expressed with out outright writer calling people evil thats the type of writing of childrens books where you tell the reader this person is evil to teach them values (teach them your or generally accepted values but values non the less). This was expressed with Aurelion Sol and targon very well then it was done well for the first part of Shurima and then reverted back to the old you will see this person as evil troupe. For what reason does Xerath have to kill innocents who aren't opposeing him when he wants to be the ruler of Shurima

I feel like you're mistaking WAAARGHbobo's opinions of Noxus and how he wrote Kled's opinions of Noxus. The two aren't linked; it's Kled who thinks like that. WAAARGHbobo's opinions on Noxus aren't relevant to the discussion here. Be mad at the irate yordle, not his writer.

Also:

> In Runeterra, EVERYONE has magic powers.

False. Magic's a rarity in Runeterra. That's already been discussed. Folks with magic are rarities, that's why so many champions have magic - they're those rarities.

http://ask.fm/RiotJaredan/answers/137122144197

To support Sharjo's magic point, here's Jaredan's response on the subject.

> Pretty rare, though it varies a bit. Your average Demacian would completely freak out at the sight of Lux letting rip. An Ionian would still be pretty bloody impressed though.

So it's completely incorrect to say eveyone is Runeterra has magic.

I don't think Riot is trying to this. Waaaarghbobo is speaking as if he was Kled. Riot has stated they don't want to make noxus evil and generic.

Your making a mountain out of a mole hill here.

You say Swain isn't a schemer?Then you haven't read the other lore pieces surrounding him.

When Kieran Darkwill challenged Swain for the position of the Grand general,it is heavily implied that Swain himself didn't fight,since he used attacks that resemble Leblancs attacks and Darius executed Kieran once she rooted Kieran Darius swooped in to ult him.
Meaning that Swain didn't even go to his own duel...

Then there is the fact that Swain attacked J4 during his League judgement,when his opponents guard was down.

And he and Leblanc started the Kalamanda incident,while letting it look like J4 attacked Swain.

Last but not least,it is implied that Swain got Boram Darkwill killed,while making it look like Demacia assassinated him.Swain didn't challenge Boram to a fight.

1. I'm not sure if you know this, but Swain is REALLY evil. Like, one of the evilest characters in League of Legends. He is stupidly evil. As Grand Tactician of Noxus, he is in charge of most things. Do you know what that means!? He invaded Ionia! He used chemical warfare on both Ionians and Noxians! He is what caused Riven's exile! He is responsible for the ressurection of Sion! It was his plan! The Ionian Invasion is his plan! Sion's ressurection is his plan! Everything evil that has ever happened in Noxus can be traced back to the dynamic duo (trio?) of Swain and LeBlanc (and Vladimir).

2. It doesn't take a genius to see that that comment he made wasn't serious in the slightest. You are making a mountain out of a mole hill here.

Uhm actually Swain had nothing to do with Ionias invasion.
That was Boram Darkwill the guy who ruled before Swain.

And Swain didn't resurrect Sion,he merely reprogrammed him.

And being the head of Noxus doesn't make you evil. Swain has ulterior motives (as showcased by Sion's reprogramming, he no longer needs to be subtle) but we don't really know what those are and how it affects Noxus and the rest of the world. 

We can't really claim to understand his current moral alignment because we don't know his intentions. At least in my opinion.
It seems too black and white.
